optimization.initÂ¶

Source: src\optimization\__init__.py

Module OverviewÂ¶

Professional optimization framework for control engineering applications.

This module provides a comprehensive optimization framework featuring:

  • Multiple state-of-the-art optimization algorithms (PSO, DE, GA, CMA-ES, Bayesian)

  • Professional objective functions for control performance metrics

  • Advanced convergence monitoring and analysis

  • Comprehensive result visualization and comparison tools

  • Extensible architecture for research and production use

For backward compatibility, legacy interfaces are maintained.

Complete Source CodeÂ¶

  1#======================================================================================\\\
  2#============================ src/optimization/__init__.py ============================\\\
  3#======================================================================================\\\
  4
  5"""Professional optimization framework for control engineering applications.
  6
  7This module provides a comprehensive optimization framework featuring:
  8- Multiple state-of-the-art optimization algorithms (PSO, DE, GA, CMA-ES, Bayesian)
  9- Professional objective functions for control performance metrics
 10- Advanced convergence monitoring and analysis
 11- Comprehensive result visualization and comparison tools
 12- Extensible architecture for research and production use
 13
 14For backward compatibility, legacy interfaces are maintained.
 15"""
 16
 17# =============================================================================
 18# NEW FRAMEWORK INTERFACES
 19# =============================================================================
 20
 21# Core framework components
 22from .core import (
 23    Optimizer, ObjectiveFunction, Constraint, OptimizationProblem,
 24    OptimizationResult, ParameterSpace, ConvergenceMonitor,
 25    OptimizationProblemBuilder, ControlOptimizationProblem,
 26    ContinuousParameter, DiscreteParameter, ContinuousParameterSpace,
 27    OptimizationContext, optimize
 28)
 29
 30# Advanced optimization algorithms
 31from .algorithms import (
 32    ParticleSwarmOptimizer, DifferentialEvolution, GeneticAlgorithm,
 33    NelderMead, BFGSOptimizer
 34    # BayesianOptimization, CMAES  # Not available yet
 35)
 36
 37# Professional objective functions
 38from .objectives import (
 39    TrackingErrorObjective, EnergyConsumptionObjective, StabilityMarginObjective,
 40    RobustnessObjective, SettlingTimeObjective, OvershootObjective,
 41    SteadyStateErrorObjective, WeightedSumObjective, ParetoObjective,
 42    SimulationBasedObjective, AnalyticalObjective, CompositeObjective
 43)
 44
 45# Constraint management
 46# from .constraints import (  # Not implemented yet
 47#     ParameterConstraint, PerformanceConstraint, StabilityConstraint
 48# )
 49
 50# Results analysis and visualization
 51# from .results import (  # Not fully implemented yet
 52#     ConvergenceAnalyzer, ConvergenceMonitor, OptimizationPlotter,
 53#     AlgorithmComparator, OptimizationStatistics
 54# )
 55
 56# Solver interfaces
 57# from .solvers import (  # Not implemented yet
 58#     OptimizationSolver, MultiObjectiveSolver, ConstrainedSolver
 59# )
 60
 61# =============================================================================
 62# BACKWARD COMPATIBILITY INTERFACES
 63# =============================================================================
 64
 65# Legacy PSO tuner (exact same interface)
 66from .algorithms.pso_optimizer import PSOTuner
 67
 68# =============================================================================
 69# EXPORTS
 70# =============================================================================
 71
 72# New framework exports
 73__all__ = [
 74    # Core interfaces
 75    "Optimizer", "ObjectiveFunction", "Constraint", "OptimizationProblem",
 76    "OptimizationResult", "ParameterSpace", "ConvergenceMonitor",
 77    "OptimizationProblemBuilder", "ControlOptimizationProblem",
 78    "ContinuousParameter", "DiscreteParameter", "ContinuousParameterSpace",
 79    "OptimizationContext", "optimize",
 80
 81    # Algorithms
 82    "ParticleSwarmOptimizer", "DifferentialEvolution", "GeneticAlgorithm",
 83    "BayesianOptimization", "NelderMead", "CMAES",
 84
 85    # Objectives
 86    "TrackingErrorObjective", "EnergyConsumptionObjective", "StabilityMarginObjective",
 87    "SettlingTimeObjective", "OvershootObjective", "SteadyStateErrorObjective",
 88    "SimulationBasedObjective", "AnalyticalObjective", "CompositeObjective",
 89
 90    # Constraints
 91    "ParameterConstraint", "PerformanceConstraint", "StabilityConstraint",
 92
 93    # Results and analysis
 94    "ConvergenceAnalyzer", "ConvergenceMonitor", "OptimizationPlotter",
 95    "AlgorithmComparator", "OptimizationStatistics",
 96
 97    # Solvers
 98    "OptimizationSolver", "MultiObjectiveSolver", "ConstrainedSolver",
 99
100    # Legacy compatibility (IMPORTANT: maintain exact same name)
101    "PSOTuner",  # Original PSO tuner from pso_optimizer.py
102]
103
104# =============================================================================
105# CONVENIENCE FACTORY FUNCTIONS
106# =============================================================================
107
108def create_optimizer(algorithm: str, parameter_space: ParameterSpace, **kwargs) -> Optimizer:
109    """Create an optimizer of specified type.
110
111    Parameters
112    ----------
113    algorithm : str
114        Algorithm name ('pso', 'de', 'ga', 'cma_es', 'bayesian', 'nelder_mead')
115    parameter_space : ParameterSpace
116        Parameter space to optimize over
117    **kwargs
118        Algorithm-specific parameters
119
120    Returns
121    -------
122    Optimizer
123        Configured optimizer instance
124
125    Examples
126    --------
127    >>> import numpy as np
128    >>> from src.optimization import create_optimizer, ContinuousParameterSpace
129    >>>
130    >>> # Define parameter space
131    >>> bounds = ContinuousParameterSpace(
132    ...     lower_bounds=np.array([0.1, 0.1, 0.1]),
133    ...     upper_bounds=np.array([10.0, 10.0, 10.0]),
134    ...     names=['kp', 'ki', 'kd']
135    ... )
136    >>>
137    >>> # Create PSO optimizer
138    >>> optimizer = create_optimizer('pso', bounds, population_size=50)
139    """
140    algorithm = algorithm.lower()
141
142    if algorithm == 'pso':
143        return ParticleSwarmOptimizer(parameter_space, **kwargs)
144    elif algorithm == 'de':
145        return DifferentialEvolution(parameter_space, **kwargs)
146    elif algorithm == 'ga':
147        return GeneticAlgorithm(parameter_space, **kwargs)
148    elif algorithm == 'cma_es':
149        return CMAES(parameter_space, **kwargs)
150    elif algorithm == 'bayesian':
151        return BayesianOptimization(parameter_space, **kwargs)
152    elif algorithm == 'nelder_mead':
153        return NelderMead(parameter_space, **kwargs)
154    else:
155        raise ValueError(f"Unknown algorithm: {algorithm}")
156
157
158def create_control_problem(objective_type: str,
159                         controller_factory: callable,
160                         simulation_config: dict,
161                         parameter_bounds: tuple,
162                         **kwargs) -> ControlOptimizationProblem:
163    """Create a control optimization problem.
164
165    Parameters
166    ----------
167    objective_type : str
168        Type of objective ('tracking', 'energy', 'settling_time', 'overshoot')
169    controller_factory : callable
170        Function to create controller from parameters
171    simulation_config : dict
172        Simulation configuration
173    parameter_bounds : tuple
174        (lower_bounds, upper_bounds) arrays
175    **kwargs
176        Objective-specific parameters
177
178    Returns
179    -------
180    ControlOptimizationProblem
181        Configured optimization problem
182
183    Examples
184    --------
185    >>> def controller_factory(params):
186    ...     return PIDController(kp=params[0], ki=params[1], kd=params[2])
187    >>>
188    >>> problem = create_control_problem(
189    ...     'tracking',
190    ...     controller_factory,
191    ...     {'sim_time': 10.0, 'dt': 0.01},
192    ...     (np.array([0.1, 0.1, 0.1]), np.array([10.0, 10.0, 10.0])),
193    ...     reference_trajectory=reference_signal
194    ... )
195    """
196    # Create parameter space
197    lower_bounds, upper_bounds = parameter_bounds
198    parameter_space = ContinuousParameterSpace(lower_bounds, upper_bounds)
199
200    # Create objective function
201    if objective_type == 'tracking':
202        objective = TrackingErrorObjective(
203            simulation_config, controller_factory, **kwargs
204        )
205    elif objective_type == 'energy':
206        objective = EnergyConsumptionObjective(
207            simulation_config, controller_factory, **kwargs
208        )
209    elif objective_type == 'settling_time':
210        objective = SettlingTimeObjective(
211            simulation_config, controller_factory, **kwargs
212        )
213    elif objective_type == 'overshoot':
214        objective = OvershootObjective(
215            simulation_config, controller_factory, **kwargs
216        )
217    else:
218        raise ValueError(f"Unknown objective type: {objective_type}")
219
220    return ControlOptimizationProblem(
221        objective, parameter_space, controller_factory, simulation_config
222    )
223
224
225def run_optimization_study(problems: list,
226                          algorithms: list,
227                          n_runs: int = 10,
228                          parallel: bool = True,
229                          **kwargs) -> dict:
230    """Run comprehensive optimization study comparing multiple algorithms.
231
232    Parameters
233    ----------
234    problems : list
235        List of optimization problems
236    algorithms : list
237        List of algorithm names or configured optimizers
238    n_runs : int, optional
239        Number of independent runs per algorithm
240    parallel : bool, optional
241        Whether to run in parallel
242    **kwargs
243        Additional options
244
245    Returns
246    -------
247    dict
248        Comprehensive study results with statistical analysis
249
250    Examples
251    --------
252    >>> problems = [problem1, problem2]
253    >>> algorithms = ['pso', 'de', 'ga']
254    >>> results = run_optimization_study(problems, algorithms, n_runs=30)
255    >>>
256    >>> # Results contain statistical analysis, convergence curves, etc.
257    >>> print(results['summary'])
258    """
259    from .benchmarks import OptimizationBenchmark
260
261    benchmark = OptimizationBenchmark()
262    return benchmark.run_study(problems, algorithms, n_runs, parallel, **kwargs)
263
264
265# Add convenience functions to exports
266__all__.extend([
267    "create_optimizer",
268    "create_control_problem",
269    "run_optimization_study"
270])
271
272# =============================================================================
273# QUICK START EXAMPLES
274# =============================================================================
275
276def example_pid_tuning():
277    """Example: PID controller tuning using PSO.
278
279    This example demonstrates how to optimize PID controller parameters
280    for a tracking objective using the new framework.
281    """
282    import numpy as np
283
284    # Define PID controller factory
285    def create_pid_controller(params):
286        kp, ki, kd = params
287        # Return your PID controller implementation
288        return PIDController(kp=kp, ki=ki, kd=kd)
289
290    # Create optimization problem
291    problem = create_control_problem(
292        'tracking',
293        create_pid_controller,
294        simulation_config={'sim_time': 10.0, 'dt': 0.01, 'initial_state': np.zeros(6)},
295        parameter_bounds=(np.array([0.1, 0.01, 0.001]), np.array([10.0, 1.0, 0.1])),
296        reference_trajectory=np.ones((1000, 2))  # Step reference
297    )
298
299    # Create PSO optimizer
300    optimizer = create_optimizer('pso', problem.parameter_space, population_size=50)
301
302    # Run optimization
303    result = optimize(problem, 'pso', random_seed=42)
304
305    print(f"Optimal PID gains: Kp={result.x[0]:.3f}, Ki={result.x[1]:.3f}, Kd={result.x[2]:.3f}")
306    print(f"Optimal cost: {result.fun:.6f}")
307
308    return result
309
310
311def example_algorithm_comparison():
312    """Example: Compare multiple optimization algorithms.
313
314    This example shows how to compare PSO, DE, and GA algorithms
315    on the same control optimization problem.
316    """
317    # Create test problem (same as above)
318    problem = create_control_problem(
319        'tracking',
320        lambda params: PIDController(*params),
321        {'sim_time': 5.0, 'dt': 0.01},
322        (np.array([0.1, 0.01, 0.001]), np.array([10.0, 1.0, 0.1]))
323    )
324
325    # Compare algorithms
326    results = run_optimization_study(
327        problems=[problem],
328        algorithms=['pso', 'de', 'ga'],
329        n_runs=10
330    )
331
332    # Analyze results
333    print("Algorithm Comparison Results:")
334    for alg, stats in results['algorithm_comparison'].items():
335        print(f"{alg}: Mean={stats['mean_fitness']:.6f}, Std={stats['std_fitness']:.6f}")
336
337    return results
338
339
340# Note: Actual PIDController class would need to be imported or defined
341# This is just for demonstration of the framework architecture

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def create_optimizer(algorithm: str, parameter_space: ParameterSpace, **kwargs) -> Optimizer:
 2    """Create an optimizer of specified type.
 3
 4    Parameters
 5    ----------
 6    algorithm : str
 7        Algorithm name ('pso', 'de', 'ga', 'cma_es', 'bayesian', 'nelder_mead')
 8    parameter_space : ParameterSpace
 9        Parameter space to optimize over
10    **kwargs
11        Algorithm-specific parameters
12
13    Returns
14    -------
15    Optimizer
16        Configured optimizer instance
17
18    Examples
19    --------
20    >>> import numpy as np
21    >>> from src.optimization import create_optimizer, ContinuousParameterSpace
22    >>>
23    >>> # Define parameter space
24    >>> bounds = ContinuousParameterSpace(
25    ...     lower_bounds=np.array([0.1, 0.1, 0.1]),
26    ...     upper_bounds=np.array([10.0, 10.0, 10.0]),
27    ...     names=['kp', 'ki', 'kd']
28    ... )
29    >>>
30    >>> # Create PSO optimizer
31    >>> optimizer = create_optimizer('pso', bounds, population_size=50)
32    """
33    algorithm = algorithm.lower()
34
35    if algorithm == 'pso':
36        return ParticleSwarmOptimizer(parameter_space, **kwargs)
37    elif algorithm == 'de':
38        return DifferentialEvolution(parameter_space, **kwargs)
39    elif algorithm == 'ga':
40        return GeneticAlgorithm(parameter_space, **kwargs)
41    elif algorithm == 'cma_es':
42        return CMAES(parameter_space, **kwargs)
43    elif algorithm == 'bayesian':
44        return BayesianOptimization(parameter_space, **kwargs)
45    elif algorithm == 'nelder_mead':
46        return NelderMead(parameter_space, **kwargs)
47    else:
48        raise ValueError(f"Unknown algorithm: {algorithm}")

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def create_control_problem(objective_type: str,
 2                         controller_factory: callable,
 3                         simulation_config: dict,
 4                         parameter_bounds: tuple,
 5                         **kwargs) -> ControlOptimizationProblem:
 6    """Create a control optimization problem.
 7
 8    Parameters
 9    ----------
10    objective_type : str
11        Type of objective ('tracking', 'energy', 'settling_time', 'overshoot')
12    controller_factory : callable
13        Function to create controller from parameters
14    simulation_config : dict
15        Simulation configuration
16    parameter_bounds : tuple
17        (lower_bounds, upper_bounds) arrays
18    **kwargs
19        Objective-specific parameters
20
21    Returns
22    -------
23    ControlOptimizationProblem
24        Configured optimization problem
25
26    Examples
27    --------
28    >>> def controller_factory(params):
29    ...     return PIDController(kp=params[0], ki=params[1], kd=params[2])
30    >>>
31    >>> problem = create_control_problem(
32    ...     'tracking',
33    ...     controller_factory,
34    ...     {'sim_time': 10.0, 'dt': 0.01},
35    ...     (np.array([0.1, 0.1, 0.1]), np.array([10.0, 10.0, 10.0])),
36    ...     reference_trajectory=reference_signal
37    ... )
38    """
39    # Create parameter space
40    lower_bounds, upper_bounds = parameter_bounds
41    parameter_space = ContinuousParameterSpace(lower_bounds, upper_bounds)
42
43    # Create objective function
44    if objective_type == 'tracking':
45        objective = TrackingErrorObjective(
46            simulation_config, controller_factory, **kwargs
47        )
48    elif objective_type == 'energy':
49        objective = EnergyConsumptionObjective(
50            simulation_config, controller_factory, **kwargs
51        )
52    elif objective_type == 'settling_time':
53        objective = SettlingTimeObjective(
54            simulation_config, controller_factory, **kwargs
55        )
56    elif objective_type == 'overshoot':
57        objective = OvershootObjective(
58            simulation_config, controller_factory, **kwargs
59        )
60    else:
61        raise ValueError(f"Unknown objective type: {objective_type}")
62
63    return ControlOptimizationProblem(
64        objective, parameter_space, controller_factory, simulation_config
65    )

run_optimization_study(problems, algorithms, n_runs, parallel)Â¶

Run comprehensive optimization study comparing multiple algorithms.

ParametersÂ¶

problems : list List of optimization problems algorithms : list List of algorithm names or configured optimizers n_runs : int, optional Number of independent runs per algorithm parallel : bool, optional Whether to run in parallel **kwargs Additional options

ReturnsÂ¶

dict Comprehensive study results with statistical analysis

ExamplesÂ¶

problems = [problem1, problem2] algorithms = [â€˜psoâ€™, â€˜deâ€™, â€˜gaâ€™] results = run_optimization_study(problems, algorithms, n_runs=30)

Results contain statistical analysis, convergence curves, etc.

print(results[â€˜summaryâ€™])

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def run_optimization_study(problems: list,
 2                          algorithms: list,
 3                          n_runs: int = 10,
 4                          parallel: bool = True,
 5                          **kwargs) -> dict:
 6    """Run comprehensive optimization study comparing multiple algorithms.
 7
 8    Parameters
 9    ----------
10    problems : list
11        List of optimization problems
12    algorithms : list
13        List of algorithm names or configured optimizers
14    n_runs : int, optional
15        Number of independent runs per algorithm
16    parallel : bool, optional
17        Whether to run in parallel
18    **kwargs
19        Additional options
20
21    Returns
22    -------
23    dict
24        Comprehensive study results with statistical analysis
25
26    Examples
27    --------
28    >>> problems = [problem1, problem2]
29    >>> algorithms = ['pso', 'de', 'ga']
30    >>> results = run_optimization_study(problems, algorithms, n_runs=30)
31    >>>
32    >>> # Results contain statistical analysis, convergence curves, etc.
33    >>> print(results['summary'])
34    """
35    from .benchmarks import OptimizationBenchmark
36
37    benchmark = OptimizationBenchmark()
38    return benchmark.run_study(problems, algorithms, n_runs, parallel, **kwargs)

example_pid_tuning()Â¶

Example: PID controller tuning using PSO.

This example demonstrates how to optimize PID controller parameters for a tracking objective using the new framework.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def example_pid_tuning():
 2    """Example: PID controller tuning using PSO.
 3
 4    This example demonstrates how to optimize PID controller parameters
 5    for a tracking objective using the new framework.
 6    """
 7    import numpy as np
 8
 9    # Define PID controller factory
10    def create_pid_controller(params):
11        kp, ki, kd = params
12        # Return your PID controller implementation
13        return PIDController(kp=kp, ki=ki, kd=kd)
14
15    # Create optimization problem
16    problem = create_control_problem(
17        'tracking',
18        create_pid_controller,
19        simulation_config={'sim_time': 10.0, 'dt': 0.01, 'initial_state': np.zeros(6)},
20        parameter_bounds=(np.array([0.1, 0.01, 0.001]), np.array([10.0, 1.0, 0.1])),
21        reference_trajectory=np.ones((1000, 2))  # Step reference
22    )
23
24    # Create PSO optimizer
25    optimizer = create_optimizer('pso', problem.parameter_space, population_size=50)
26
27    # Run optimization
28    result = optimize(problem, 'pso', random_seed=42)
29
30    print(f"Optimal PID gains: Kp={result.x[0]:.3f}, Ki={result.x[1]:.3f}, Kd={result.x[2]:.3f}")
31    print(f"Optimal cost: {result.fun:.6f}")
32
33    return result

example_algorithm_comparison()Â¶

Example: Compare multiple optimization algorithms.

This example shows how to compare PSO, DE, and GA algorithms on the same control optimization problem.

Source CodeÂ¶

 1def example_algorithm_comparison():
 2    """Example: Compare multiple optimization algorithms.
 3
 4    This example shows how to compare PSO, DE, and GA algorithms
 5    on the same control optimization problem.
 6    """
 7    # Create test problem (same as above)
 8    problem = create_control_problem(
 9        'tracking',
10        lambda params: PIDController(*params),
11        {'sim_time': 5.0, 'dt': 0.01},
12        (np.array([0.1, 0.01, 0.001]), np.array([10.0, 1.0, 0.1]))
13    )
14
15    # Compare algorithms
16    results = run_optimization_study(
17        problems=[problem],
18        algorithms=['pso', 'de', 'ga'],
19        n_runs=10
20    )
21
22    # Analyze results
23    print("Algorithm Comparison Results:")
24    for alg, stats in results['algorithm_comparison'].items():
25        print(f"{alg}: Mean={stats['mean_fitness']:.6f}, Std={stats['std_fitness']:.6f}")
26
27    return results
